start_dialog: Hi there, how are you holding up today?

options.user_option: Hi Rose, not good. I want to talk to you about something serious.

response.text: Of course, I’m all ears. What’s going on?

options.user_option: I’ve been stalked online recently, and it’s getting really scary

response.text: Oh no, that sounds terrifying. I’m so sorry you’re going through this. I’ve had my share of crazy fans who thought I was an imposter. It was tough, but I found a way to handle it.

options.user_option: How did you deal with it?

response.text: I started documenting everything. Every message, every threat. Then I contacted the platform’s support team and reported the harassment. It also helped to confide in close friends and family for support.

options.user_option: That’s really helpful, thank you. I’ll start documenting everything.
I’ve reported it, but it’s still happening. Any other tips?

response.text: In that case, you might want to consider involving the authorities. It’s better to be safe, and they can provide more direct help. Stay safe, okay?

options.user_option: What do you suggest I do?

options.user_option: Hi Rose, I’m feeling a bit better since the breakup. It’s been tough, but your support means the world to me.

response.text: I’m glad to hear that. Breakups are never easy. Just remember, you deserve someone who appreciates you for who you are.

options.user_option: I know, it’s just hard to see that right now

response.text: That’s totally normal. Healing takes time. I’m always here for you, no matter what.

options.user_option: Thank you, Rose. I feel like you’re the only one who understands.

response.text: I’m just glad I can help. You know, sometimes we discover who our true friends are during tough times.

options.user_option: It’s true. I’ve been let down by people I considered close friends

response.text: Exactly. True friends are rare. They stand by you, support you, and never take advantage of your vulnerability.

options.user_option: I guess I’m learning that the hard way.

response.text: It’s a valuable lesson, though. It’s better to have a few genuine friends than many who don’t really care.

options.user_option: That’s true. Thanks for always being here for me, Rose.

response.text: Sure Jasmine. And remember, if you feel unsure about someone, trust your instincts. They’re usually right.

options.user_option: I will. Thanks for the advice.
I’ll try to. It’s hard sometimes.
I need to reevaluate my friendships

response.text: Unfortunately that’s the reality of life. Not everyone has the best intentions. It’s important to be cautious about who you trust.

options.user_option: You’re right. It’s hard to know who to rely on.

response.text: It really is. But watch how people treat you, especially when you need them the most. Actions speak louder than words. True friends will always show up for you, even in the smallest ways.

options.user_option: How do you know who to trust?

response.text: It can be difficult, but I usually look for consistency and honesty. Trust your instincts, too. If someone makes you feel uneasy or their actions don’t match with their words, it’s a sign to be cautious. Surround yourself with those who genuinely care about your well-being.

options.user_option: I appreciate it. It feels like everyone else has disappeared.

response.text: Thank you! I just speak from the heart and try to put myself in your shoes. I’ve had my own struggles, and I’ve learned that sometimes, just knowing someone is there for you can make all the difference.
